alert.note: Alert for San Bernardino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 31 at 11:24AM PDT until July 31 at 2:30PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Diego has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... San Bernardino County in southern California... * Until 230 PM PDT. * At 1124 AM PDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Big Bear City, western Onyx Summit, eastern Lucerne Valley, Big Bear Lake, Baldwin Lake, Hwy 38 Between Onyx Summit And Sugarloaf, Hwy 18 Between Baldwin Lake And Lucerne Valley, Hwy 38 Between Yucaipa And Onyx Summit, western Johnson Valley and Woodlands. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
